message.content:
cs.CL, cs.IR, cs.SI, cs.CY, cs.CR 

This paper deals with the problem of authorship linkability in community-based reviewing, which involves analyzing textual information such as product or service reviews. Therefore, the most likely sub-category is cs.CL (Computation and Language), which deals with natural language processing and computational linguistics. The paper also involves information retrieval (cs.IR) techniques to identify and link reviews authored by the same person. Additionally, the paper explores the use of crowdsourcing (cs.SI) and machine translation (cs.CL) to mitigate authorship linkability. Finally, the paper deals with privacy and security issues (cs.CY) related to online content and user identification.
